intro: Pavonia dentata, commonly known as the toothed pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy, pink to reddish-purple bract-like flowers. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, giving it the common name "toothed." Pavonia dentata typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
